episodeTitle: Luffy's All-out Attack! Red Hawk Blasts!
description: Luffy unleashes his devastating new technique Red Hawk against Hody Jones, dealing massive damage. Meanwhile, Brook demonstrates mastery of his soul abilities, Chopper reveals control over Monster Point, and Usopp continues setting traps for Daruma.

events.title: Brook Reveals True Yomi Yomi no Mi Abilities
events.description: Brook demonstrates his mastery over the Yomi Yomi no Mi Devil Fruit, explaining that his soul can maintain corporeal existence and allowing him to reassemble his body even when his skull is separated. He reveals the true extent of the fruit's abilities go far beyond simple resurrection.
events.significance: This is the first time Brook demonstrates the advanced capabilities of his Devil Fruit, showing he can control his soul energy after his training during the timeskip. This represents a major power upgrade for Brook.

quotes.text: The power of soul keeping me alive allows me to reassemble my bones!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook explains his ability to reattach his severed head

events.title: Soul Solid Sword Technique Revealed
events.description: Brook reveals his Soul Solid technique, a sword that is imbued with the cold air from the land of the dead. The blade is freezing cold and can freeze opponents' blood solid.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's ability to enhance his sword with his soul's energy, bringing the cold of the underworld into the physical world. This becomes one of his signature techniques.

quotes.text: Soul Solid brings the very cold of the underworld into this world!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook explains his ice-infused sword technique

events.title: Shyarly Advises Children to Judge Humans with Their Own Eyes
events.description: Madam Shyarly tells the fish-man children not to blindly hate humans, advising them to judge what they think of humans with their own eyes rather than inheriting prejudice.
events.significance: Represents a thematic moment about breaking cycles of hatred and prejudice, central to the Fish-Man Island arc's message about racism and understanding.

quotes.text: Don't think that way. Judge what you think of humans with your own eyes.
quotes.speaker: Shyarly
quotes.context: Shyarly advises the children about forming their own opinions on humans

events.title: Usopp Reveals Midori Boshi: Humandrake
events.description: Usopp uses Midori Boshi: Humandrake, a Pop Green trap that triggers when opponents step on it, causing humanoid plants to leap toward enemies and entangle them with root-like limbs.
events.significance: Showcases Usopp's growth as a strategist and his new plant-based combat abilities learned during the timeskip on the Boin Archipelago.

quotes.text: Don't rush around so much, mole rat. I just finished setting up a trap.
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp confidently reveals his trap for Daruma

events.title: Chopper Reveals Controlled Monster Point
events.description: Chopper transforms into Monster Point using a Rumble Ball, but unlike before, he maintains full conscious control over this form. He explains he can control it for three minutes with a single Rumble Ball.
events.significance: This is a massive power upgrade for Chopper, as his Monster Point was previously uncontrollable and made him attack allies and enemies indiscriminately. This demonstrates the fruits of his two-year training.

quotes.text: I'm okay, Usopp! I can control it for three minutes with a Rumble Ball!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper reassures Usopp about his new control over Monster Point

events.title: Luffy Debuts Red Hawk
events.description: Luffy unleashes his new technique Gomu Gomu no Red Hawk, combining Gear Second with Armament Haki to create a flaming punch that deals devastating damage to Hody Jones. Before using it, Luffy recalls images of his late brother Ace, as the technique is a tribute to Ace's Fire Fist.
events.significance: This is Luffy's first fire-based attack and represents both his emotional connection to Ace and his mastery of combining Gear Second with Haki. It becomes one of his signature techniques and symbolizes carrying on Ace's will. The attack sends Hody flying to the Noah ship.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashes his new fire-based technique for the first time

events.title: Luffy Remembers Ace Before Red Hawk
events.description: As Luffy prepares to use Red Hawk, flashback imagery of Ace appears, showing Luffy's emotional connection to his late brother. The technique is modeled after Ace's signature Fire Fist attack.
events.significance: This moment shows how deeply Ace's death affected Luffy and how he honors his brother's memory through his fighting style. The Red Hawk technique serves as an eternal tribute to Ace.

events.title: Guards Announce Hody's Defeat
events.description: After witnessing Red Hawk's devastating power, the guards announce Hody's defeat. Lower-ranked New Fish-Man Pirates members attempt to flee with their captain apparently defeated.
events.significance: This moment shows the impact of Luffy's attack and creates a temporary sense of victory, though Hody is not actually finished yet.

events.title: Zeo Stops Deserters and Demands They Die for Their Grudge
events.description: When lower-ranked members try to flee after Hody's apparent defeat, Zeo attacks and stops them, declaring they should die for their grudge against humans. This demonstrates the fanaticism of the New Fish-Man Pirates officers.
events.significance: Shows the extremist ideology of the New Fish-Man Pirates and their willingness to sacrifice their own crew members for their hatred of humans.

events.title: Brook Declares Faith in Luffy
events.description: Brook stops Zeo from attacking his own men and declares that the island will be fine because he knows Luffy will save everybody.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' faith in their captain and contrasts their trust and camaraderie with the New Fish-Man Pirates' fanaticism and willingness to sacrifice their own.

quotes.text: The island will be fine. I know Luffy will save everybody.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook expresses his unwavering faith in Luffy's ability to save Fish-Man Island

events.title: Straw Hats Prepare to End Their Battles
events.description: Franky, Sanji, Jinbe, and Zoro all prepare to finish their respective opponents, signaling the climax of the battles at Gyoncorde Plaza is approaching.
events.significance: Sets up the conclusion of all the crew's individual battles in the next episode.

events.title: Hody Consumes More Energy Steroids Despite Severe Injuries
events.description: Despite being seriously injured by Red Hawk and vomiting blood, Hody Jones desperately forces more Energy Steroids into his mouth, refusing to accept defeat. His wounds are severe but he continues fighting through sheer hatred and drug-fueled power.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hody's dangerous addiction to Energy Steroids and his willingness to destroy his own body in his quest for revenge against humans. This sets up his continued fight despite Luffy's overwhelming power.

events.title: Luffy Heads to the Noah
events.description: After hitting Hody with Red Hawk and sending him flying to the Noah ship, Luffy makes his way toward the massive ship to continue the battle.
events.significance: Transitions the battle location from Gyoncorde Plaza to the Noah, setting up the final confrontation between Luffy and Hody.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashes his new fire-based technique

quotes.text: I'm okay, Usopp! I can control it for three minutes with a Rumble Ball!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper reveals his new control over Monster Point

quotes.text: Don't rush around so much, mole rat. I just finished setting up a trap.
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp confidently reveals his strategy against Daruma

quotes.text: The island will be fine. I know Luffy will save everybody.
quotes.speaker: Brook

quotes.text: Don't think that way. Judge what you think of humans with your own eyes.
quotes.speaker: Shyarly

themes.description: Luffy's Red Hawk technique serves as a tribute to his late brother Ace, showing how he carries Ace's memory and will into battle. The technique combines fire like Ace's signature attack.
themes.symbolism: The flames of Red Hawk symbolize Ace's spirit living on through Luffy, representing the bonds of brotherhood that transcend death.

themes.description: Shyarly's advice to the children about judging humans with their own eyes represents the arc's message about ending cycles of prejudice and hatred passed down through generations.
themes.symbolism: The children represent the future of Fish-Man Island and the possibility of breaking free from inherited hatred.

themes.description: Multiple Straw Hats demonstrate the results of their two-year training: Brook's soul mastery, Chopper's Monster Point control, and Usopp's strategic confidence all show how they've evolved.
themes.symbolism: The crew's new abilities symbolize their readiness for the New World and their growth as individuals.

themes.description: The New Fish-Man Pirates' willingness to die for their grudge and Hody's continued consumption of Energy Steroids despite severe injuries shows the destructive nature of hatred and extremism.
themes.symbolism: The Energy Steroids represent the self-destructive path of those consumed by hatred.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy debuts his Red Hawk technique, showing both his combat evolution and his emotional connection to Ace. The technique demonstrates his mastery of combining Gear Second with Armament Haki.
keyActions: Unleashes Gomu Gomu no Red Hawk
Sends Hody Jones flying to the Noah with overwhelming force
Heads toward the Noah to continue the battle

characterSpotlights.development: Brook reveals the true extent of his Yomi Yomi no Mi abilities, showing his growth during the timeskip. He demonstrates soul manipulation, body reassembly, and the Soul Solid technique.
keyActions: Reattaches his severed head using soul power
Reveals Soul Solid ice sword technique
Declares faith in Luffy's ability to save the island
quotes: The island will be fine. I know Luffy will save everybody.

characterSpotlights.role: Supporting fighter with new transformation control
characterSpotlights.development: Chopper unveils his controlled Monster Point transformation, a massive upgrade from his previous berserk state. This shows significant progress from his training.
keyActions: Transforms into Monster Point with a Rumble Ball
Maintains conscious control of the form
Reassures Usopp about his three-minute control limit
quotes: I'm okay, Usopp! I can control it for three minutes with a Rumble Ball!

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp shows newfound confidence in his abilities, no longer being shaken by opponents calling him weak. His strategic mind and Pop Green techniques showcase his growth.
keyActions: Sets up Midori Boshi: Humandrake trap for Daruma
Demonstrates strategic thinking over brute force
quotes: Don't rush around so much, mole rat. I just finished setting up a trap.

characterSpotlights.development: Despite taking devastating damage from Red Hawk, Hody's fanatical hatred drives him to consume more Energy Steroids, showing his self-destructive nature and addiction to power.
keyActions: Takes massive damage from Red Hawk
Forces more Energy Steroids into his mouth
Prepares to continue fighting despite wounds

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime added extended flashback imagery of Ace before Luffy uses Red Hawk, emphasizing the emotional connection to the technique more than the manga.
The anime shows Luffy using Jet Bazooka before Red Hawk, which was not in the manga version of this scene.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Luffy's Red Hawk technique, which would become one of his signature moves throughout the series.
The Red Hawk technique uses the same kanji (火拳銃) as Ace's Fire Fist attack, making the tribute explicit in the Japanese version.
This episode adapted material from Chapters 643 (pages 6-11), 644 (pages 18-19), and 645 (pages 2-4, 13-19) of the manga.

Brook's revelation about his soul abilities in this episode expands on lore first established when he explained his Devil Fruit powers, showing the Yomi Yomi no Mi offers much more than just resurrection.

sources.title: Yomi Yomi no Mi - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Chopper's controlled Monster Point represents a callback to his uncontrolled rampage during the Enies Lobby arc, showing how far he's come in mastering his Devil Fruit.
